answers.answer: Hi there!Temporary erectile dysfunction can develop in young adults due to a variety of causes. Psychological stress, performance anxiety, depression, medications, alcohol, smoking, drugs/medications, hypertension, diabetes, prostatitis, urethritis etc. just to name a few. Anxiety and stress play an important role in the development of erectile dysfunction; and is the most common possible cause. At a primary level, I would suggest being a bit relaxed and working on the psychological factors. It might also be beneficial to get rid of factors like smoking/ alcohol/ drugs, if involved. In case this doesn’t work, or you have difficulty controlling anxiety; I would suggest seeing your primary care physician or a urologist for an evaluation of the above mentioned causes and appropriate specific treatment.Hope this helps.Take care!

question: 46 yr old male here.  i recently hooked up with an old girl freind and had sex.  i had three erections in 2 hours with her help and ejaculated each time.  Did not take any drugs, just normal vaginal intercourse in a short period of time.  It has been about a week and I am still having weak erections and have trouble maintaining an erection.  I can still ejaculate  but the erection is weak.  Is it in my head or did I damage something having that much sex in a short period?  Are my chemicals off?   Do I just need to rest it longer?  Kinda worried here.
title: Am I just tired and need a rest
